review: Dr. Gayatri Rao is a gem of a person. She handled my case really well.Actually, my own gynaecologist was out of town during the week of my delivery and in her absence I was referred for a C-section by the team of assistant doctors of my gynaecologist, since I was diagnosed with Oligoamnios due to low amniotic fluid level in the last week of pregnancy. This created anxiety and a state of panic, as everything was on track for a normal delivery until the last scan done in week 36 of my pregnancy. We then began to look elsewhere in the hope of a normal delivery. I was then given a very strong recommendation of Dr. Gayatri Rao by my sister-in-law who had a normal delivery under her supervision, despite a critical pregnancy.So, we rushed to Womens Hospital for an emergency consultation and delivery by Dr. Gayatri Rao as I was already past my due date into week 41 and had gone into early labour. She responded to our late night emergency call and visited us at the hospital as soon as possible despite us having no prior appointment with her. After meeting her, we immediately realised that we were in the best hands. She assessed and explained the best possible outcome of my case with a calm composure. She tried all possible methods in the next 26 hours to induce and dilate for a normal delivery. By the grace of God and expertise of Dr. Gayatri Rao and team, I had a normal delivery and am blessed with a healthy baby girl.A big shoutout to the staff and team of doctors at Womens Hospital as well, as they worked tirelessly for pulling off something no less than a miracle. I have not seen or heard of any doctor who has displayed so much patience in pursuit of a normal delivery under such critical circumstances.I highly recommend Dr. Gayatri Rao and Womens Hospital for expertise on pregnancy related cases. Thank you so much Doctor, you are an angel indeed!
